weather_report:
As night descends upon Downtown San Francisco, a thick blanket of rain-drenched clouds envelops the city, casting an atmosphere of muted grey. The streets glisten under the streetlights, reflecting the steady drizzle that heralds a significant downpour. With temperatures poised to hover around a comfortably cool 57 degrees, the South Southeast winds whip through the air, adding a brisk edge to the damp surroundings. Visibility may be limited, as the promise of substantial rainfall continues, with the forecast hinting at a deluge of up to two inches by tomorrow. As you gaze across the landscapes framed by views of the Golden Gate and downtown towers, any hint of fog lingers, shrouding the hills and softening the sharp contours of the skyline.

Dressing for this evening requires an embrace of warmth and water resistance; a good raincoat and sturdy footwear will serve well against puddles and misty air. While outdoor excursions may seem less inviting, the ambiance lends itself beautifully to the simple pleasures of an evening indoors. Consider finding solace in a cozy café where you can watch the rain dance against the window, perhaps savoring a warm beverage amidst conversations that carry over the gentle patter of droplets. Alternatively, a local bookstore could offer an inviting retreat, where time can be spent lost in the pages of a good book, layered in quiet comfort as the world outside stirs with the rhythm of rain.
